translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: When I opened the sliding door of the room,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 中では五十六が三つ指ついて頭を下げていた。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Inside, Isoroku was kneeling on all fours and bowing his head.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「先程、ランス殿が私の部屋に来られるというので、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Earlier, since Lord Rance said he would come to my room,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ここでお待ちしておりました」
「三十分くらいはあったが……マジか……」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "It was about thirty minutes though... seriously...?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「？　そんなところで如何しました？」
にっこりと笑って五十六は促す。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Isoroku smiled warmly and invited me in.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 五十六がランスの背後に近づき、
マントをそっと取ろうとする。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and quietly tried to take his cloak off.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「いや、なんか、妙にサービス良くないか？」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "No, isn't this some kind of unusually good service?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: おそらく大陸とでは文化が違うのですね」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Probably the culture on the continent is different."
she devotes herself to her husband."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 正室や側室の関係ではありませんが、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: not his legal wife or concubine,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 私はランス殿の子を産んだ……」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: but I gave birth to Lord Rance's child..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「家族であることに変わりはありません」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "There is no change in being family."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「JAPANでは妻は旦那にこうするものですが……
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "In JAPAN, such is how a wife behaves toward her husband, but...
is there something strange about this?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: これがJAPANの一般的な妻なのか……」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: so this is what a typical JAPAN wife is like..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: （相変わらず、形式にこだわる石頭だ……）
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: (As usual, a stubborn fool obsessed with formalities...)
If that's the case, then it's fine."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「では、お食事になさいますか？
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Well then, would you like to have a meal?
"How is the taste of the food...?

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: お口に合えば良いのですが……」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: I hope it suits your palate..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 五十六に料理の腕があったのは知らんかった」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: I didn't know Isoroku had culinary skills."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「もう武人としての私は捨て、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "I have already abandoned myself as a warrior,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 母になるつもりでしたから……
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and intended to become a mother..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 料理も鍛えておりました」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: I have been training in cooking as well."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: そういや、乱義が気になるだろう」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: you must be concerned about Rangyoku."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「今もあの子はランス城で元気にやっている筈……
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "He should still be doing well at Rance Castle now..."

translationLines.description: Array of objects, each representing a line from the input

originalJapaneseLine.description: The original line in Japanese exactly as it was in the input

translatedEnglishLine.description: The original line translated to English
